evidence: The French Foreign Legion is a corps of the French Army created to allow foreign nationals into French service.
The Legion was founded in 1831 and today consists of several specialties, namely infantry, cavalry, engineers, and airborne troops.
The Foreign Legion has remained an important part of the French Army.
